alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from New Hope and Smith east to Awendaw. As much as 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen in this area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Awendaw, Huger, Smith, Limerick, Charity, Richmond, Buck Hall, Woodland, Hagan, Woodland Landing and Comingtee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
